qas.question: When did the RIR begin to host the Capital City 400?
When did the Suntrust Indy Challenge stop being run at RIR?
In what direction does one travel from Richmond to reach Southside Speedway?
What is the shape of Southside Speedway?
Along with "The Action Track," what is a nickname of Southside Speedway?

context: Auto racing is also popular in the area. The Richmond International Raceway (RIR) has hosted NASCAR Sprint Cup races since 1953, as well as the Capital City 400 from <a0_0>1962<a0_0/> − 1980. RIR also hosted IndyCar's Suntrust Indy Challenge from 2001 − <a1_0>2009<a1_0/>. Another track, Southside Speedway, has operated since 1959 and sits just <a2_0>southwest<a2_0/> of Richmond in Chesterfield County. This .333-mile (0.536 km) <a3_0>oval<a3_0/> short-track has become known as the "<a4_0>Toughest Track in the South<a4_0/>" and "The Action Track", and features weekly stock car racing on Friday nights. Southside Speedway has acted as the breeding grounds for many past NASCAR legends including Richard Petty, Bobby Allison and Darrell Waltrip, and claims to be the home track of NASCAR superstar Denny Hamlin.
